required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Non-Interventional Study (NIS) Collecting Experiences For IPF in Taiwan
clinical_study.official_title: Non-Interventional Study (NIS) Collecting Experiences For IPF in Taiwan

brief_summary.textblock: This is a non-interventional, multi-center study to collect data from patients with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF) in clinical practice in Taiwan. The study will be carried out at 10 medical centers, the expert centers where IPF patients are mainly managed in Taiwan.

primary_outcome.measure: Annual Change From Baseline in Percentage of Predicted Forced Vital Capacity (FVC) at Week 52
primary_outcome.description: Annual Change from Baseline in percentage of predicted Forced Vital Capacity (FVC) at Week 52 was reported.

primary_outcome.measure: Annual Change From Baseline in Percentage of Predicted Forced Vital Capacity (FVC) at Week 100
primary_outcome.description: Annual Change from Baseline in percentage of predicted Forced Vital Capacity (FVC) at Week 100 was reported.

primary_outcome.measure: Annual Change From Baseline in Percentage of Predicted Diffusing Capacity of the Lungs for Carbon Monoxide (DLco) at Week 52
primary_outcome.description: Annual Change from Baseline in percentage of predicted Diffusing capacity of the Lungs for Carbon monoxide (DLco) at Week 52 was reported

primary_outcome.measure: Annual Change From Baseline in Percentage of Predicted Diffusing Capacity of the Lungs for Carbon Monoxide (DLco) at Week 100
primary_outcome.description: Annual Change from Baseline in percentage of predicted Diffusing capacity of the Lungs for Carbon monoxide (DLco) at Week 100 was reported.

primary_outcome.measure: Annual Change From Baseline in Percentage of Predicted Oxygen Saturation (SpO2) at Week 52
primary_outcome.description: Annual Change from Baseline in percentage of predicted oxygen saturation (SpO2) at Week 52 was reported.

primary_outcome.measure: Annual Change From Baseline in Percentage of Predicted Oxygen Saturation (SpO2) at Week 100
primary_outcome.description: Annual Change from Baseline in percentage of predicted oxygen saturation (SpO2) at Week 100 was reported.

primary_outcome.measure: Annual Change From Baseline in Percentage of Predicted Total Lung Capacity (TLC) at Week 52
primary_outcome.description: Annual Change from Baseline in percentage of predicted Total Lung Capacity (TLC) at Week 52was reported.

primary_outcome.measure: Annual Change From Baseline in Percentage of Predicted Total Lung Capacity (TLC) at Week 100
primary_outcome.description: Annual Change from Baseline in percentage of predicted Total Lung Capacity (TLC) at Week 100 was reported.

primary_outcome.measure: Annual Change From Baseline in Percentage of Predicted Inspiratory Capacity (IC) at Week 52
primary_outcome.description: Annual Change from Baseline in percentage of predicted Inspiratory Capacity (IC) at Week 52 was reported.

primary_outcome.measure: Annual Change From Baseline in Percentage of Predicted Inspiratory Capacity (IC) at Week 100
primary_outcome.description: Annual Change from Baseline in percentage of predicted Inspiratory Capacity (IC) at Week 100 was reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to First Acute Exacerbation of Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline until end of follow-up, up to 899 days.
secondary_outcome.description: Time to first acute exacerbation of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis was reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Annual Change in Total Score of St. Georges Respiratory Questionnaire (SGRQ) at Week 52
secondary_outcome.description: The SGRQ is a 50-item questionnaire developed to measure health status (quality of life) in patients with diseases of airways obstruction. The questionnaire included 3 subscales measures: symptoms, activity limitation, and social, and emotional impact of disease (each subscale score ranges from 0 to 100 with higher score indicating poorer quality of life). The SGRQ total score was calculated by summing weights from all positive items, divided by sum of weights for all items in SGRQ questionnaire and multiplying by 100. The total score of SGRQ ranged from 0 (no effect on quality of life) to 100 (maximum perceived distress). Thus, a higher score indicated a poorer quality of life. Annual change in score of St. Georges Respiratory Questionnaire (SGRQ) at Week 52 was reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Annual Change in Total Score of St. Georges Respiratory Questionnaire (SGRQ) at Week 100
secondary_outcome.description: The SGRQ is a 50-item questionnaire developed to measure health status (quality of life) in patients with diseases of airways obstruction. The questionnaire included 3 subscales measures: symptoms, activity limitation, and social, and emotional impact of disease (each subscale score ranges from 0 to 100 with higher score indicating poorer quality of life). The SGRQ total score was calculated by summing weights from all positive items, divided by sum of weights for all items in SGRQ questionnaire and multiplying by 100. The total score of SGRQ ranged from 0 (no effect on quality of life) to 100 (maximum perceived distress). Thus, a higher score indicated a poorer quality of life. Annual change in score of St. Georges Respiratory Questionnaire (SGRQ) at Week 100 was reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Annual Change in Score of Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease Assessment Test (CAT) at Week 52
secondary_outcome.description: The Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) Assessment Test (CAT) is an 8-item, health status instrument which provides a method for assessing the impact of COPD on the patient's health and quality of life. The CAT score (ranging from 0 to 40) was calculated for each individual by summing the points for each item. A decrease in CAT score represents an improvement in health status, whereas an increase in CAT score represents a worsening in health status.

secondary_outcome.measure: Annual Change in Score of Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease Assessment Test (CAT) at Week 100
secondary_outcome.description: The Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) Assessment Test (CAT) is an 8-item, health status instrument which provides a method for assessing the impact of COPD on the patient's health and quality of life. The CAT score (ranging from 0 to 40) was calculated for each individual by summing the points for each item. A decrease in CAT score represents an improvement in health status, whereas an increase in CAT score represents a worsening in health status.

secondary_outcome.measure: Annual Change in Six-Minute Walk Test (6MWT) at Week 52
secondary_outcome.description: Annual change in Six-Minute Walk Test (6MWT) at Week 52 was reported. The 6MWT measured the distance that a person can walk in 6 minutes, providing information regarding functional capacity, response to therapy and prognosis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Annual Change in Six-Minute Walk Test (6MWT) at Week 100
secondary_outcome.description: Annual change in Six-Minute Walk Test (6MWT) at Week 100 was reported. The 6MWT measured the distance that a person can walk in 6 minutes, providing information regarding functional capacity, response to therapy and prognosis.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline until end of follow-up, up to 899 days.
secondary_outcome.description: Overall survival was reported. Overall survival was defined as the time from randomization to death due to any cause.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Per Death Reason Categories
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline until end of follow-up, up to 899 days.
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants per death reason categories was reported.

study_pop.textblock: The study will be carried out at 10 medical centers, the expert centers where idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF) patients are mainly managed in Taiwan.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients can be included if ALL the following criteria are met:
1.Newly diagnosed with IPF within 6 months based upon recent ATS/ERS/JRS/ALAT IPF guideline (Ref 1, Raghu G, et al. 2011).
- Exclusion of other known causes of ILD (e.g. domestic and occupational environmental exposures, connective tissue disease, and drug toxicity).
- Assessment of IPF based on HRCT or HRCT and surgical lung biopsy, if available. 2.Patient â‰¥ 20 years of age 3.Written informed consent prior to participation 4.Patients with further follow-up possible with participating physician during planned study period 5.Ability to read and write in the local language
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients should not be included if ANY of the following criteria is met:
1. Lung transplantation expected within next 6 months.
2. Inclusion in ongoing clinical trials.

facility.name: Kaohsiung Medical University Chung-Ho Memorial Hospital

participant_flow.recruitment_details: This was a non-interventional multi-center study based on newly collected data on idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF) patients in clinical practice in Taiwan with a planned 2-year followed-up period to characterize the IPF population in Taiwan with regard to their clinical course under clinical practice conditions in Taiwan.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: All subjects were screened for eligibility prior to participation in the trial. Subjects attended a specialist site which ensured that they (the subjects) strictly met all inclusion and none of the exclusion criteria. Subjects were not to be allocated to a treatment group if any of the entry criteria were violated.

group.title: Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis With Anti-fibrotic Drug
group.description: Eligible patients with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF) who signed the informed consent and fulfilled all inclusion criteria and no exclusion criteria, recruiting from 10 hospitals in Taiwan, and used anti-fibrotic drug were included in this group.

group.title: Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis Without Anti-fibrotic Drug
group.description: Eligible patients with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF) who signed the informed consent and fulfilled all inclusion criteria and no exclusion criteria, recruiting from 10 hospitals in Taiwan, and did not use anti-fibrotic drug were included in this group.

outcome.title: Annual Change in Total Score of St. Georges Respiratory Questionnaire (SGRQ) at Week 52
outcome.description: The SGRQ is a 50-item questionnaire developed to measure health status (quality of life) in patients with diseases of airways obstruction. The questionnaire included 3 subscales measures: symptoms, activity limitation, and social, and emotional impact of disease (each subscale score ranges from 0 to 100 with higher score indicating poorer quality of life). The SGRQ total score was calculated by summing weights from all positive items, divided by sum of weights for all items in SGRQ questionnaire and multiplying by 100. The total score of SGRQ ranged from 0 (no effect on quality of life) to 100 (maximum perceived distress). Thus, a higher score indicated a poorer quality of life. Annual change in score of St. Georges Respiratory Questionnaire (SGRQ) at Week 52 was reported.
outcome.population: All eligible patients: all patients who signed the informed consent and fulfilled all inclusion criteria and no exclusion criteria.

group.title: Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis Without Anti-fibrotic Drug
group.description: Eligible patients with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF) who signed the informed consent and fulfilled all inclusion criteria and no exclusion criteria, recruiting from 10 hospitals in Taiwan, and did not use anti-fibrotic drug were included in this group.

measure.title: Annual Change in Score of Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease Assessment Test (CAT) at Week 52
measure.description: The Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) Assessment Test (CAT) is an 8-item, health status instrument which provides a method for assessing the impact of COPD on the patient's health and quality of life. The CAT score (ranging from 0 to 40) was calculated for each individual by summing the points for each item. A decrease in CAT score represents an improvement in health status, whereas an increase in CAT score represents a worsening in health status.
measure.population: All eligible patients: all patients who signed the informed consent and fulfilled all inclusion criteria and no exclusion criteria.

analysis.groups_desc: Intra-group difference comparing to baseline was analyzed.
Intra-group difference comparing to baseline was analyzed.

The CAT score (ranging from 0 to 40) was calculated for each individual by summing the points for each item. analysis.groups_desc: Intra-group difference comparing to baseline was analyzed.

outcome.title: Annual Change in Six-Minute Walk Test (6MWT) at Week 52
outcome.description: Annual change in Six-Minute Walk Test (6MWT) at Week 52 was reported. The 6MWT measured the distance that a person can walk in 6 minutes, providing information regarding functional capacity, response to therapy and prognosis.
outcome.population: All eligible patients: all patients who signed the informed consent and fulfilled all inclusion criteria and no exclusion criteria.

outcome.title: Overall Survival
outcome.description: Overall survival was reported. Overall survival was defined as the time from randomization to death due to any cause.
outcome.time_frame: From baseline until end of follow-up, up to 899 days.
outcome.population: All eligible patients: all patients who signed the informed consent and fulfilled all inclusion criteria and no exclusion criteria.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Boehringer Ingelheim (BI) acknowledges that investigators have the right to publish the study results. Investigators shall provide BI with a copy of any publication or presentation for review prior to any submission. Such review will be done with regard to proprietary information, information related to patentable inventions, medical, scientific, and statistical accuracy within 60 days. BI may request a delay of the publication in order to protect BI's intellectual property rights.
